fields.definition: To arise is to happen.
fields.sentence: Difficulties arose with his computer because it was old.

fields.definition: A benefactor is a person who gives money to help someone.
fields.sentence: The student’s benefactor gave him money to spend on his studies.

fields.definition: A blacksmith is a person who makes things out of metal.
fields.sentence: The blacksmith pounded the piece of metal until it was flat.

fields.definition: When someone is charitable, they help people who are in need.
fields.sentence: My sister was charitable enough to help me buy my first house.

fields.definition: A chimney is a tall pipe used to carry smoke out of a building.
fields.sentence: The cat was on the roof sitting next to the chimney.

fields.definition: To compensate is to pay someone for the time they spent doing something.
fields.sentence: Her boss compensated her for the extra work she did last week.

fields.definition: If you encounter something, you meet or come close to it.
fields.sentence: I encountered a sea turtle while I was swimming.

fields.definition: To exceed is to be more than something.
fields.sentence: Since I exceeded my limit, I decided to get rid of my credit cards.

fields.definition: To forge is to make or produce, especially with difficulty.
fields.sentence: Stacy and Heather forged their friendship when they were teenagers.

fields.definition: People who are humble do not believe that they are better than other people.
fields.sentence: Even though Bob is the smartest boy in his class, he is humble.

fields.definition: Iron is a strong metal that is used to make many objects.
fields.sentence: The horse had shoes made of iron.

fields.definition: A ladder is an object that is used to climb up and down things.
fields.sentence: He used a ladder to climb to the top of his tree house.

fields.definition: If people are modest, they do not think that they are too important.
fields.sentence: Derek is very modest for someone who is so rich.

fields.definition: To occupy a place is to live, work, or be there.
fields.sentence: Kevin and Alice occupied the chairs and had a long discussion.

fields.definition: A penny is a coin worth one cent.
fields.sentence: U.S. President Abraham Lincoln is on the penny.

fields.definition: To preach is to talk about and promote a religious idea.
fields.sentence: Aaron often preached about living an honest life.

fields.definition: To prosper is to be successful or make a lot of money.
fields.sentence: Frank’s new business finally prospered after many years of hard work.

fields.definition: A province is a small area that is controlled by a country.
fields.sentence: Canada is divided into several different provinces.

fields.definition: Satisfaction is a feeling you get when you do or receive something good.
fields.sentence: Brad was filled with satisfaction when he saw what was for dinner.

fields.definition: To sustain something is to keep it going.
fields.sentence: Wind power is a clean way to sustain a city with energy.

fields.definition: To acquire something is to gain possession of it.
fields.sentence: Tina acquired a strange package yesterday.

fields.definition: If something is awkward, it is embarrassing and uncomfortable.
fields.sentence: After dropping his coffee cup, Robbie felt awkward.

fields.definition: A caretaker is a person who takes care of very young, old, or sick people.
fields.sentence: My grandmother’s caretaker helps her get around the house.

fields.definition: To deceive someone is to make them believe something that is not true.
fields.sentence: He tried to deceive his friends as they were playing a game.

fields.definition: To discourage someone is to make them feel less excited about something.
fields.sentence: Mr. Perry discouraged the students from quitting school.

fields.definition: If something is fake, it is made to look real in order to trick people.
fields.sentence: The model was wearing fake eyelashes.

fields.definition: Hatred is a strong feeling of not liking someone or something.
fields.sentence: I have a hatred for the taste of medicine.

fields.definition: A hut is a house made of wood, grass, or mud that has only one or two rooms.
fields.sentence: We all went into the hut to sleep.

fields.definition: If something is inferior, it is not as good as something else.
fields.sentence: Cars built a hundred years ago are inferior to ones built today.

fields.definition: A lodge is a house in the mountains, used by people who hunt or fish.
fields.sentence: During our ski trip, we stayed at a lodge.

fields.definition: To neglect someone or something is to not take care of it properly.
fields.sentence: William neglected his room, so it is a complete mess.

fields.definition: A newcomer is a person who has recently arrived at a place or a group.
fields.sentence: The students happily welcomed the newcomer to the school.

fields.definition: An offense is behavior that is wrong or breaks a law.
fields.sentence: Stealing a car is a very serious offense.

fields.definition: To overlook something is to not notice it, or to not realize that it is important.
fields.sentence: Brenda overlooked the last step and had a bad fall.

fields.definition: To repay is to pay back or to reward someone or something.
fields.sentence: She repaid her friend for all of his hard work with a small gift.

fields.definition: If something is ridiculous, it is silly or strange.
fields.sentence: Steve looked ridiculous with those huge blue sunglasses.

fields.definition: If something is satisfactory, it is good enough.
fields.sentence: Mina often received satisfactory grades since she studied so hard.

fields.definition: A shepherd is a person who protects and cares for sheep.
fields.sentence: The shepherd moved the sheep to another field.

fields.definition: To venture is to go to a place that may be dangerous.
fields.sentence: Even though it was dangerous, they ventured up the mountain.

fields.definition: Wheat is a plant which makes grain. Wheat grain is used to make bread.
fields.sentence: The field of golden wheat was ready to be harvested.

fields.definition: An alley is a narrow road behind houses or buildings.
fields.sentence: The alley behind my house looks dirty.

fields.definition: An ax is a tool used to cut wood.
fields.sentence: She used an ax to cut some wood for the fire.

fields.definition: A bunch is a group of the same things.
fields.sentence: She was hungry, so she ate the entire bunch of grapes.

fields.definition: A chore is a job that you have to do but don’t like.
fields.sentence: It’s Nikki’s chore to do the dishes every Tuesday and Wednesday night.

fields.definition: When something is decent, it is OK or good enough.
fields.sentence: Eric did a decent job painting the fence.

fields.definition: Disgrace is a feeling of shame.
fields.sentence: He felt a sense of disgrace after failing his big exam.

fields.definition: The elbow is the middle part of a person’s arm that lets you bend it.
fields.sentence: She pointed to her elbow to show me where she hurt herself.

fields.definition: When you are grateful for something, you are happy that it happened.
fields.sentence: The girls were grateful to have a chance to spend time with their grandfather.

fields.definition: To irritate means to annoy someone.
fields.sentence: She was irritated when her brother told her that he had lost her camera.

fields.definition: To kid is to make a joke to make someone believe something which is not true.
fields.sentence: I am not really mad. I was kidding when I said I was angry.

fields.definition: When something is loose, it is not held in place well.
fields.sentence: The bolt was loose, so I tightened it with the wrench.

fields.definition: To offend someone means to make them angry or upset.
fields.sentence: They were both offended by what they had said to each other.

fields.definition: When something happens overnight, it happens during the night.
fields.sentence: The campers stayed in the tent overnight.

fields.definition: To persist means to keep doing something even when it is hard.
fields.sentence: Even though the lesson was difficult, he persisted until he understood.

fields.definition: A pine is a type of tree that is tall and thin.
fields.sentence: There were many beautiful pine trees in the forest.

fields.definition: A scar is a mark on the skin after a wound heals.
fields.sentence: The monster had horrible scars on his cheek and forehead.

fields.definition: A sensation is a feeling a person gets from their senses.
fields.sentence: Mom got a painful sensation in her head from the loud noise.

fields.definition: A sled is a small vehicle that you use on snow.
fields.sentence: Marvin likes to ride his sled down the hill in winter.

fields.definition: To tease someone means to laugh at or make fun of them.
fields.sentence: Jake teased Charlie because he was the new student.

fields.definition: A valentine is someone you love or admire with great affection.
fields.sentence: Harry wanted Molly to be his valentine.

fields.definition: When a plant blooms, it makes flowers.
fields.sentence: Roses look so pretty when they bloom.

fields.definition: If something is compact, it is smaller than normal.
fields.sentence: A laptop computer is much more compact than a desktop model.

fields.definition: A curl is a small piece of something with a round shape.
fields.sentence: The colorful ribbons were bent into curls.

fields.definition: To decay is to be destroyed naturally.
fields.sentence: The old wooden house was slowly decaying.

fields.definition: Dessert is a sweet food that you eat after a meal.
fields.sentence: Kayla wants ice cream for dessert.

fields.definition: To dip something is to put part of it into a liquid for a short time.
fields.sentence: Laurel dipped her strawberry into the chocolate.

fields.definition: If something is distant, it is far away.
fields.sentence: Michael could barely see the distant island.

fields.definition: An eclipse is an occasion when the moon moves in front of the sun.
fields.sentence: A complete eclipse of the sun is a very rare occurrence.

fields.definition: A fairy is a small, magic creature with wings.
fields.sentence: There are usually fairies in fantasy stories.

fields.definition: Grace is a quality of moving in a smooth, relaxed and attractive way.
fields.sentence: The ballerina danced with grace.

fields.definition: Leisure is time when you do not have to do work.
fields.sentence: Eve likes to listen to music in her leisure time.

fields.definition: Mankind is all of the world’s people.
fields.sentence: All of mankind has to work to make this a better world.

fields.definition: Passion is a very strong feeling of wanting to do something.
fields.sentence: She had a passion for dancing.

fields.definition: A pillow is something that you put your head on when you sleep.
fields.sentence: When I travel, I usually take along my favorite pillow.

fields.definition: A pulse is the beat of the heart.
fields.sentence: The doctor checked the patient’s pulse by feeling his wrist.

fields.definition: To refresh someone is to make them feel less hot or tired.
fields.sentence: The baby was refreshed after taking a cool bath.

fields.definition: To sneeze is to suddenly blow air out of your nose and mouth.
fields.sentence: He sneezed after smelling the flower.

fields.definition: A spice is a flavor for food and drinks.
fields.sentence: Two common spices found in many homes are salt and pepper.

fields.definition: To whistle is to make a sound by putting your lips together and blowing.
fields.sentence: Ashe was listening to music, Daryl whistled.

fields.definition: Wool is the hair that a sheep has.
fields.sentence: Grandma wants to use the blue wool to knit me a sweater.

fields.definition: To acquaint is to get to know something or someone.
fields.sentence: Nancy acquainted herself with the new computer.

fields.definition: A cemetery is where people are buried when they die.
fields.sentence: Some people are scared of cemeteries.

fields.definition: To curse someone or something is to hope that bad things happen to them.
fields.sentence: The witch cursed the village.

fields.definition: A disguise is something you wear so people cannot tell who you are.
fields.sentence: Everyone knew that it was Dad in the Santa disguise.

fields.definition: If something is fancy, it is nicer than normal.
fields.sentence: Their table was all set for a fancy dinner.

fields.definition: A flashlight is a small electric light that you carry in your hand.
fields.sentence: We took a flashlight when we went camping.

fields.definition: A hood is part of a coat that goes over your head.
fields.sentence: She put on her hood to keep her head warm.

fields.definition: An inhabitant is a person who lives in a certain place.
fields.sentence: The number of inhabitants in the countryside is increasing.

fields.definition: To nourish something is to give it food that it needs to live.
fields.sentence: A good mother will nourish her baby every day.

fields.definition: A pirate is a sailor who steals things from other boats.
fields.sentence: Pirates are very scary characters.

fields.definition: A publication is something printed, like a newspaper or book.
fields.sentence: She’s been a subscriber to that publication for over ten years.

fields.definition: A riddle is a question that is difficult to answer but meant to be funny.
fields.sentence: I could not answer Wendy’s riddle, but it made me laugh.

fields.definition: When something rots, it slowly gets softer and is destroyed.
fields.sentence: The old log began to rot in the forest.

fields.definition: To scare means to cause one to feel frightened.
fields.sentence: I was scared by the sight of the monster.

fields.definition: If something will happen shortly, it will happen very soon.
fields.sentence: My workday will end shortly.

fields.definition: A skeleton is the bones of a body.
fields.sentence: There is a skeleton in the science classroom.

fields.definition: If something spoils, it turns bad or rots.
fields.sentence: We left the fruit out too long, and it spoiled.

fields.definition: If a person starves, they do not get enough to eat and sometimes die.
fields.sentence: During the war, many people starved.

fields.definition: A thrill is an exciting feeling.
fields.sentence: The boys enjoy the thrill of surfing a big wave.

fields.definition: If something is wicked, it is very bad or evil.
fields.sentence: My boss is a very wicked man.

fields.definition: To alert someone is to tell or warn them about something.
fields.sentence: The fire alarm alerted us that there was a problem.

fields.definition: A broadcast is a television or radio show.
fields.sentence: We watched the broadcast of the local news on TV.

fields.definition: A bulletin is a news report that talks about very recent and important events.
fields.sentence: There was a live bulletin reporting on the economy of the city.

fields.definition: A bump is a small raised area on a surface.
fields.sentence: The monkey got a bump on his head because he was hit by a rock.

fields.definition: To chop something means to cut it into pieces with a tool.
fields.sentence: Mom chopped some vegetables to put into the stew.

fields.definition: A closet is a small room used to store things.
fields.sentence: Marie has many clothes inside o f her closet.

fields.definition: To console someone who is sad means to make them comforted.
fields.sentence: When my dog ran away, my dad consoled me.

fields.definition: A district is a small part of a city, county, state, or country.
fields.sentence: I live in a residential district of Seattle, Washington.

fields.definition: A drawer is a small part in furniture that is used to store things.
fields.sentence: I put my clothes into the empty drawers.

fields.definition: To endure something tough means to do or go through it.
fields.sentence: She had to endure her husband shouting all day long.

fields.definition: To execute someone means to kill them as a legal punishment.
fields.sentence: Some people are executed for serious crimes.

fields.definition: To grasp something means to hold it.
fields.sentence: He grasped the bag o f money tightly.

fields.definition: When something is in the rear of something, it is in the back.
fields.sentence: The man loaded the rear of his truck with boxes.

fields.definition: A senator is someone who makes laws for a state.
fields.sentence: The young senator promised to make laws that would help the people.

fields.definition: A skull is the hard part of your head. Your brain is inside of it.
fields.sentence: The brain is protected by the skull.

fields.definition: To stir something means to mix it using something small, like a spoon.
fields.sentence: Mom stirred the batter until it was smooth.

fields.definition: To tap something is to hit it lightly.
fields.sentence: He tapped the keys of the keyboard to write a short word.

fields.definition: When something is tremendous, it is very large.
fields.sentence: The Earth’s oceans are filled with a tremendous amount of water.

fields.definition: When something is underneath something else, it is below or lower than it.
fields.sentence: The roots of a tree are located underneath the ground.

fields.definition: A worm is a small animal with a long, thin body.
fields.sentence: Worms are often used to help catch fish.

fields.definition: To abandon something is to leave it forever or for a long time.
fields.sentence: The old room had been abandoned years before.

fields.definition: If someone is ambitious, they want to be rich or successful.
fields.sentence: Kendra had to be ambitious to get into medical school.

fields.definition: When a dog barks, it makes a short, loud noise.
fields.sentence: The dog barked loudly and frighteningly.

fields.definition: A bay is an area near the ocean where the land goes inward.
fields.sentence: The Golden Gate Bridge crosses San Francisco Bay.

fields.definition: If someone is brilliant, they are very smart.
fields.sentence: My younger sister is brilliant for someone her age.

fields.definition: Your chin is the hard part at the bottom of your face.
fields.sentence: Luke pointed to the hair on his chin.

fields.definition: A complaint is something you say to tell people that you don’t like something.
fields.sentence: Mom said she didn’t want to hear my brother’s complaints.

fields.definition: When someone is deaf, they cannot hear.
fields.sentence: Susan was born deaf.

fields.definition: To be enthusiastic about something is to be excited by or interested in it.
fields.sentence: The man was enthusiastic about his job.

fields.definition: An expedition is a long trip, usually to a place very far away.
fields.sentence: They got into their spaceship to begin their expedition.

fields.definition: The horizon is where the sky looks like it meets the ground.
fields.sentence: The sun clipped below the horizon.

fields.definition: To be loyal to something or someone is to agree to always help them.
fields.sentence: The three friends are very loyal to each other.

fields.definition: The mayor is the person in charge of a city.
fields.sentence: The mayor o f my hometown is quite a powerful speaker.

fields.definition: If something is mutual, it is felt in the same way by two or more people.
fields.sentence: Robert likes Sarah. The feeling is mutual.

fields.definition: If someone is overweight, they are very fat.
fields.sentence: Roger eats too much, so now he’s overweight.

fields.definition: A refuge is a place where you go to be safe.
fields.sentence: When it started to rain, she found refuge in the house.

fields.definition: To restore something is to put it back the way it was.
fields.sentence: Victor restored the old car.

fields.definition: To rub something is to push on it and move your hand back and forth.
fields.sentence: Mom’s feet were sore, so she rubbed them.

fields.definition: Your senses are how you see, taste, hear, feel and smell.
fields.sentence: It would be hard to live without your five senses.

fields.definition: A veterinarian is a doctor that takes care of animals.
fields.sentence: Wanda became a veterinarian because she loves dogs.

fields.definition: An anniversary is a day that celebrates something from the past.
fields.sentence: My parents went out to eat for their wedding anniversary.

fields.definition: Arithmetic is math.
fields.sentence: I like to study arithmetic at school.

fields.definition: To be ashamed is to feel upset because you did something wrong or bad.
fields.sentence: He was ashamed when he found out that I knew about his past.

fields.definition: To burst is to suddenly break open or apart.
fields.sentence: The bomb burst over the city.

fields.definition: A carpenter is a person who builds things with wood.
fields.sentence: We hired a carpenter to make a cupboard.

fields.definition: Coal is a hard black rock that you burn for heat.
fields.sentence: Many power stations burn coal to produce energy.

fields.definition: A couch is a long, soft seat that many people can sit on.
fields.sentence: Kim and M artin’s new couch was very expensive.

fields.definition: When a liquid drips, just a little bit falls at a time.
fields.sentence: I heard water dripping from the faucet.

fields.definition: If something is elegant, it is very fancy and pleasing.
fields.sentence: In Japan, women wear elegant kimonos on special occasions.

fields.definition: Fabric is cloth used to make clothes, furniture, etc.
fields.sentence: The towels were made from a soft fabric.

fields.definition: The highlands are high areas of land, usually with mountains.
fields.sentence: The man had a small home in the highlands.

fields.definition: Ivory is a white, hard substance that comes from elephants.
fields.sentence: The elephant’s long ivory tusks looked very impressive.

fields.definition: A mill is a building where flour is made.
fields.sentence: The farmer took his wheat to the mill to make it into flour.

fields.definition: A needle is a small, sharp piece of metal that you use to make or fix clothes.
fields.sentence: I used a needle to fix the hole in my pants.

fields.definition: To polish something is to rub it in order to make it shiny.
fields.sentence: Mark spent all morning polishing his shoes for the wedding.

fields.definition: To sew means to put pieces of cloth together using string.
fields.sentence: I learned to sew when I was a little girl.

fields.definition: A shed is a small building where you store things like tools.
fields.sentence: We have a small shed in the backyard for storage.

fields.definition: A thread is a thin piece of string.
fields.sentence: I have many different colors of thread at home.

fields.definition: To trim something is to cut it a little bit.
fields.sentence: I had my hair trimmed this afternoon.

fields.definition: If something goes upwards, it moves vertically higher.
fields.sentence: The kite went upwards further and further.

fields.definition: To ail a person or group is to cause difficulty or pain.
fields.sentence: My brother went to the doctor to see what was ailing him.

fields.definition: An ally is someone who agrees to help or support you.
fields.sentence: I was happy to find many allies who shared the same opinion as me.

fields.definition: To boast is to talk about how good you are.
fields.sentence: We all became tired o f listening to him boast about him self all day.

fields.definition: To bounce is to move something up and away from a surface after hitting it.
fields.sentence: Owen bounced the ball on the ground.

fields.definition: A bully is a person who is mean to others.
fields.sentence: The two bullies always picked on the smaller, weaker kids.

fields.definition: Carbohydrates are substances in foods like bread that give you energy.
fields.sentence: Carbohydrates like rice are a good source o f energy for active people.

fields.definition: To crawl is to move slowly on your hands and knees.
fields.sentence: The baby crawled across the floor.

fields.definition: To defeat someone is to beat them in a game or battle.
fields.sentence: The champion defeated the challenger in the boxing match.

fields.definition: A dial is the front of a clock.
fields.sentence: I looked at the dial to see what time it was.

fields.definition: When someone or something is dominant, they are stronger than others.
fields.sentence: The gorilla is one o f the dominant animals in the jungle.

fields.definition: If you show mercy, you choose not to punish or harm someone.
fields.sentence: He asked his boss for mercy and to not fire him.

fields.definition: To nod is to move your head up and down.
fields.sentence: I nodded my head as I listened to the song.

fields.definition: An opponent is someone who fights against you.
fields.sentence: On the field, our opponents were too good for us.

fields.definition: To quarrel is to argue or fight.
fields.sentence: Billy quarreled with his wife about buying a new house.

fields.definition: A rival is someone that is trying to keep you from getting what you want.
fields.sentence: The three rivals were all competing for the same job.

fields.definition: When a part of your body is sore, it hurts.
fields.sentence: After lifting the heavy box, Mona’s back was sore.

fields.definition: To sting is to cause pain by pushing a sharp part into the skin.
fields.sentence: The needle stung my arm and made me say, “ Ouch!”

fields.definition: To strain is to try very hard.
fields.sentence: Casey strained to lift the heavy box.

fields.definition: Torture is something that causes you physical or mental pain.
fields.sentence: Greg thought that writing the essay was torture.

fields.definition: To wrestle is to play a game where you try to push someone to the floor.
fields.sentence: My dad loved to wrestle when he was in high school.

fields.definition: Absence is the state of something being away.
fields.sentence: There is an absence of sand in the hourglass.

fields.definition: If you say something aloud, you say it so that others can hear you.
fields.sentence: My father often reads stories aloud to me and my sister.

fields.definition: If someone is bald, they have no hair.
fields.sentence: My oldest brother is bald.

fields.definition: A blanket is a piece of cloth that you use to keep warm or to sit upon.
fields.sentence: I laid a blanket on the ground so that we could have a picnic.

fields.definition: To creep is to move quietly and slowly.
fields.sentence: The cat slowly crept down the tree.

fields.definition: Divorce is an event in which a marriage is ended.
fields.sentence: Divorce rates have increased in the past twenty years.

fields.definition: To imitate someone is to do exactly what they do.
fields.sentence: He imitated his favorite superhero by putting on a costume.

fields.definition: An infant is a baby.
fields.sentence: The infant cried all night.

fields.definition: To kidnap someone is to take them illegally.
fields.sentence: She was terrified to find out her son was kidnapped.

fields.definition: A nap is a short sleep, usually during the day.
fields.sentence: I took a short nap because I stayed up late last night.

fields.definition: You use nowhere to say that a place or thing does not exist.
fields.sentence: Unfortunately, water was nowhere to be found.

fields.definition: To pat something is to hit it softly with your hand.
fields.sentence: I patted some lotion onto my face.

fields.definition: Relief is a feeling you get when something bad or challenging ends.
fields.sentence: I felt a sense of relief when I heard the good news.

fields.definition: To reproduce is to make something exactly how someone else did it.
fields.sentence: The children tried to reproduce their house using toy blocks.

fields.definition: To rhyme is to have the same sounds at the end of a word.
fields.sentence: Humpty Dumpty is an old rhyme that children learn in school.

fields.definition: To suck is to put something in your mouth and try to get flavor out of it.
fields.sentence: The baby sucked milk from her bottle.

fields.definition: If something is urgent, it is important and needs to be done now.
fields.sentence: He had to leave now; it was urgent.

fields.definition: To vanish is to go away suddenly.
fields.sentence: All the passengers vanished from the train station.

fields.definition: A wagon is a cart you use to carry heavy things.
fields.sentence: He used his wagon to carry some of his gifts.

fields.definition: A wrinkle is a line on a person’s face that happens as they get old.
fields.sentence: My grandfather has some wrinkles on his face.

fields.definition: If something is abnormal, it is strange or not normal.
fields.sentence: Her idea of art is a bit too abnormal for me.

fields.definition: Bamboo is a hard plant with thin branches and leaves.
fields.sentence: Outside his home, there is a lot of bamboo.

fields.definition: A blossom is a flower or group of flowers.
fields.sentence: There were colorful blossoms in the yard.

fields.definition: A compass is a device used to tell what direction one is going.
fields.sentence: A compass is an important tool to have when you are traveling.

fields.definition: A dialect is a regional variety of language showing where you are from.
fields.sentence: People from the U.K. have a different dialect of English from those in the U.K.

fields.definition: If someone is dishonest, they do not tell the truth.
fields.sentence: She was being dishonest when she copied the answers from his test.

fields.definition: A dwarf is a creature from stories that often looks like a short, hairy man.
fields.sentence: The dwarf had a pleasant look on his face.

fields.definition: An ecosystem is a group of plants and animals in an area.
fields.sentence: The river’s ecosystem not only includes fish but other insects and plants too.

fields.definition: If something is fatal, it causes death.
fields.sentence: They passed away in a fatal car crash.

fields.definition: If someone is impatient, they are not able to wait for things.
fields.sentence: Bob was so impatient that he could barely wait for the light to turn green.

fields.definition: A leaf is the flat green thing on trees or bushes.
fields.sentence: In the fall, the leaves on the trees change colors.

fields.definition: A manuscript is an old book or paper written by hand.
fields.sentence: The manuscript was written over 150 years ago.

fields.definition: A marsh is a type of wet land covered with grasses and short plants.
fields.sentence: The marsh looked so lovely against the mountains.

fields.definition: Patience is the ability to wait for something without becoming upset.
fields.sentence: Sue’s patience was rewarded by catching her very first fish.

fields.definition: Perfume is a good-smelling liquid that girls wear.
fields.sentence: When she wore her perfume, everyone said she smelled great.

fields.definition: A pond is a very small area of water.
fields.sentence: The ducks swam in the pond.

fields.definition: A proverb is a short saying that tells you something important.
fields.sentence: The proverb “egg on your face” means you’ve done something embarrassing.

fields.definition: A pursuit is a chase.
fields.sentence: The dinosaur was in pursuit of the caveman.

fields.definition: To recite something means to repeat or say aloud in front of a group.
fields.sentence: Katie recited the Pledge of Allegiance in class.

fields.definition: A wilderness is an area where no people live.
fields.sentence: If you are not careful, you can get lost in the wilderness.

fields.definition: To anticipate something is to think that it will happen.
fields.sentence: Carrie anticipated the arrival of her baby.

fields.definition: A barrel is a round thing that you can keep liquids in.
fields.sentence: There was an empty barrel outside the house.

fields.definition: A beam is a heavy bar.
fields.sentence: Modern skyscrapers are made with several beams.

fields.definition: If something is casual, it is relaxed or simple.
fields.sentence: You can wear casual clothes to the party like jeans.

fields.definition: Caution is care and attention in order to avoid danger.
fields.sentence: Please use the power saw with caution. It is very dangerous.

fields.definition: If something is contrary to something else, it is the opposite.
fields.sentence: It isn’t warm outside at all. On the contrary, it is quite cold.

fields.definition: If you are deliberate, you do something on purpose.

fields.definition: A rod is a thin stick made of wood or metal.
fields.sentence: I bought a new fishing rod to use while on vacation.

fields.definition: If something seldom happens, it doesn’t happen very often.
fields.sentence: It seldom rains in southern Arizona.

fields.definition: To shave means to cut the hairs on your face with a sharp tool.
fields.sentence: My father shaves his face every day because he doesn’t want a beard.

fields.definition: If you are terrified, you are extremely scared.
fields.sentence: When I saw the ghost, I was absolutely terrified!

fields.definition: A wizard is a man who can do magic.
fields.sentence: The wizard made gold fall from the sky.

fields.definition: Baggage is the set of bags that people take with them when they travel.
fields.sentence: I’m taking several pieces of baggage with me on vacation.

fields.definition: A bulb is the glass part of an electric light.
fields.sentence: I had to change the light bulb in my bedroom.

fields.definition: A bundle is a number of things that are tied together.
fields.sentence: I was shocked when he showed me a bundle of money.

fields.definition: Cattle are cows and bulls, especially on a farm.
fields.sentence: The rancher’s cattle were eating the grass in the field.

fields.definition: To flee means to run away from trouble or danger.
fields.sentence: The crowd of men tried to flee from the danger.

fields.definition: To graze means to eat grass.
fields.sentence: The cows grazed in the field.

fields.definition: Greed is a desire to have more than the things that you need.
fields.sentence: She ate all the cookies out of her greed.

fields.definition: A herd is a large group of the same type of animals that live together.
fields.sentence: The herd of cows moved slowly across the ranch.

fields.definition: To initiate something means to start it.
fields.sentence: You have to turn the switch on to initiate the computer system.

fields.definition: A lane is a small road.
fields.sentence: The lane passes directly in front of our house.

fields.definition: Nerve is bravery or the belief that you can do something.
fields.sentence: He has the nerve to think that he can actually wrestle with a lion.

fields.definition: An optimist is somebody who sees the good parts of a situation.
fields.sentence: Even though he has physical problems, my brother is an optimist.

fields.definition: A parade is a celebration when groups of people walk in the same direction.
fields.sentence: There were many marching bands in the spring parade.

fields.definition: To pave the ground is to lay material on it to make it easier to walk or drive on.
fields.sentence: The path was paved with yellow bricks.

fields.definition: A phantom is a ghost or spirit.
fields.sentence: A scary phantom appeared from out of the darkness.

fields.definition: Something that is portable is able to be moved or carried easily.
fields.sentence: Since computers are portable, people can use them anywhere.

fields.definition: A poster is a written announcement that is used to advertise something.
fields.sentence: I saw a poster about a free concert in the park.

fields.definition: To scratch is to make small cuts with a claw or fingernail.
fields.sentence: I used a stick to scratch my back.

fields.definition: A symphony is a long piece of music performed by many musicians.
fields.sentence: Alex, a violin player, has always dreamt of playing a symphony.

fields.definition: A widow is a woman whose husband has died.
fields.sentence: The widow had no children and was very lonely.

fields.definition: To circulate something is to spread it quickly.
fields.sentence: The fan helped to circulate cool air through the room.

fields.definition: Consequent means happening because of a different situation.
fields.sentence: Her consequent rash came after she touched the poison ivy.

fields.definition: To derive something from another source means to get it from that thing.
fields.sentence: Red’s nickname was derived from the color of her hair.

fields.definition: To drown is to die from not being able to breathe underwater.
fields.sentence: He would have drowned if the sailors would not have rescued him.

fields.definition: A dynasty is a series of rulers who are all from the same family.
fields.sentence: The ancient Egyptians had a dynasty that lasted for many years.

fields.definition: A fraction is a small part of something.
fields.sentence: Only a fraction of the cake was gone.

fields.definition: Frost is a white layer of ice that forms during very cold weather.
fields.sentence: In the morning, the trees were all covered with frost.

fields.definition: An illusion is something that looks real, but doesn’t actually exist.
fields.sentence: Some pictures create an illusion for the eyes.

fields.definition: To invade is to take over a place by force.
fields.sentence: The enemy forces tried to invade our country through the air.

fields.definition: A lieutenant is a rank in the military or police, or a person with that rank.
fields.sentence: The lieutenant was a good leader, and his soldiers respected him.

fields.definition: The word marine describes something related to the sea.
fields.sentence: A healthy ocean is full of marine animals.

fields.definition: The merit of something or someone is their good qualities.
fields.sentence: The actor received an award for his merits in the movie.

fields.definition: A navy is the part of a country’s military that fights at sea.
fields.sentence: My country is known for our strong navy.

fields.definition: Polar relates to the cold places on Earth’s north and south ends.
fields.sentence: Only a few people live in the Earth’s northern polar region.

fields.definition: A ray is a line of light that comes from a bright object.
fields.sentence: The sun’s warm rays covered the beach.

fields.definition: To resign means to quit a job.
fields.sentence: After I officially resigned from work, I said goodbye to my boss.

fields.definition: Suicide is the act of killing oneself.
fields.sentence: Some people feel so sad that they think suicide is the only answer.

fields.definition: To tremble is to shake as a result of cold weather.
fields.sentence: Harry was not used to the cold, so he trembled most of the day.

fields.definition: When something is underlying, it is a hidden cause of something else.
fields.sentence: Her underlying fear of flying reduced her traveling options.

fields.definition: To travel via something means to travel through or using something.
fields.sentence: We arrived in the city from the airport via the train.

fields.definition: To alter something means to make a small change to it.
fields.sentence: →  I altered the color of my nails to match my hair.

fields.definition: If someone stands aside, they are on or to one side.
fields.sentence: →  The man stood aside and opened the door for me.

fields.definition: Autumn is the season of the year between summer and winter.
fields.sentence: →  I love when the leaves fall in autumn because I can play in them.

fields.definition: To blend is to mix two or more things together so that they become one thing.
fields.sentence: →  My wife blended together all of the ingredients to make a delicious stew.

fields.definition: To collapse is to fall down suddenly.
fields.sentence: →  The tree collapsed right in front of our house.

fields.definition: To crush something is to press it together so its shape is destroyed.
fields.sentence: →  Selena’s new car was crushed when something fell on top of it.

fields.definition: To curve is to move in a line that bends and does not go straight.
fields.sentence: →  The road curves to the left and to the right.

fields.definition: If something is disgusting, it is very unpleasant.
fields.sentence: →  After running all day, Greg’s feet had a disgusting odor.

fields.definition: A drain is a pipe that carries away water from a building, such as in a kitchen.
fields.sentence: →  The water in the sink goes down the drain as you wash your hands.

fields.definition: To embrace is to hug.
fields.sentence: →  When they saw each other again, the happy couple embraced.

fields.definition: To envy someone is to wish that you had something that they have.
fields.sentence: →  Sally envied the happy couple.

fields.definition: Fireworks are objects that create colored lights when they are lit.
fields.sentence: →  The display of fireworks was so beautiful.

fields.definition: Flour is a powder made from plants that is used to make foods like bread.
fields.sentence: →  I wanted to bake a pie, but I needed flour.

fields.definition: A fuse is a string that you light on fireworks to make them explode.
fields.sentence: →  The boy litthe fuse on the rocket and waited for it to burst in the sky.

fields.definition: Ginger is a spice from the root of a plant. It tastes spicy and sweet.
fields.sentence: → Ginger is a common ingredient in many dishes from India.

fields.definition: If you are jealous, you think someone might take something from you.
fields.sentence: →  Miriam was jealous because Sue was paying too much attention to Jim .

fields.definition: A paste is a thick and smooth substance.
fields.sentence: →  My son needed some paste for a school project.

fields.definition: A receipt is a paper that proves that something was received or bought.
fields.sentence: →  After looking at my receipt, I realized that I had spent too much money.

fields.definition: To wipe something is to slide a piece of cloth over it to clean it.
fields.sentence: →  She wiped the dust from the windows.

fields.definition: A wire is a thin string made out of metal.
fields.sentence: →  The wires were connected to towers that brought electricity to the city.

fields.definition: If you acknowledge something, you accept that it is true or that it exists.
fields.sentence: The teacher acknowledged that the young student was hungry.

fields.definition: An ambassador is a government worker who works in another country.
fields.sentence: The ambassador from Korea was in charge ofthe conference.

fields.definition: If someone is a blonde, they have light-colored hair.
fields.sentence: My cousin is different from me. She is a blonde with blue eyes.

fields.definition: To conquer a country means to attack and take control of it.
fields.sentence: The soldiers were trying to conquer the world.

fields.definition: To drag something means to pull it across the ground.
fields.sentence: The dog was dragging his owner down the street.

fields.definition: To exaggerate is to say that something is bigger or better than it really is.
fields.sentence: Jimmy wasn’t exaggerating about the seriousness of his injury.

fields.definition: Heritage is the collection of features of a society, such as language and religion.
fields.sentence: Teepees are part ofthe heritage of the American Indians of the plains.

fields.definition: To insult someone is to say things that will hurt their feelings.
fields.sentence: The girls insulted each other all afternoon.

fields.definition: Meanwhile means until something happens or while something is happening.
fields.sentence: He wants to be a doctor in the future, but meanwhile, he works a regular job.

fields.definition: A necklace is a piece of jewelry that people wear around their necks.
fields.sentence: Joyce received a lovely pearl necklace for her wedding anniversary.

fields.definition: A noble is a rich and powerful person.
fields.sentence: The Queen invited a noble from a nearby country to dinner.

fields.definition: When something is precious, it is valuable and important.
fields.sentence: In a desert, water can be more precious than money.

fields.definition: A prejudice is an unfair opinion about someone before you get to know them.
fields.sentence: The company’s rules against gender prejudice must be enforced.

fields.definition: A rumor is a story that may not be true.
fields.sentence: Carla was spreading rumors around the office.

fields.definition: A sin is something that is wrong for religious reasons.
fields.sentence: Taking something that doesn’t belong to you is a sin.

fields.definition: A spectacle is an amazing sight.
fields.sentence: Niagara Falls is quite a spectacle.

fields.definition: A stack is a pile of different things.
fields.sentence: There was a stack of paperwork on his desk to complete.

fields.definition: If someone is suspicious of someone else, they do not trust that person.
fields.sentence: Dad was suspicious ofthe caller on the line.

fields.definition: Tin is a cheap white metal.
fields.sentence: Soup is a common food that is often sold in tin cans.

fields.definition: A vase is an attractive container where people keep flowers.
fields.sentence: The vase was filled with such lovely flowers.

fields.definition: If something aches, it hurts.
fields.sentence: Mindy’s head ached because she bumped it against the wall.

fields.definition: If something is arctic, it is from far north near the North Pole.
fields.sentence: It is cold when the arctic winds blow.

fields.definition: A canal is a path for water to travel through.
fields.sentence: The city of Venice, Italy, has many canals.

fields.definition: A chemist is a scientist who works with chemicals.
fields.sentence: My mother is a successful chemist who helps invent new products.

fields.definition: A chill is a feeling of cold.
fields.sentence: The chill from the cold wind made Bill shiver.

fields.definition: Congress is a group of leaders in a government.
fields.sentence: → Congress makes laws for people to follow.

fields.definition: If something is dairy, it is made from milk.
fields.sentence: Things like milk and cheese are dairy foods.

fields.definition: To descend is to go downward.
fields.sentence: I descended the stairs to get out of the building.

fields.definition: A grocer is a person who sells food.
fields.sentence: Our grocer, Mr. Smith, is a very kind man.

fields.definition: To hesitate is to wait for a short time before doing something.
fields.sentence: He hesitated for a moment before he decided which choice to make.

fields.definition: An institution is an organization that works to help a city or group of people.
fields.sentence: Banks are vital institutions that businesses and people use every day.

fields.definition: To jog is to run slowly.
fields.sentence: He jogs every day so he can be healthier.

fields.definition: A merchant is a person who sells things.
fields.sentence: The merchant was selling used cars.

fields.definition: To poke something is to push it with your finger.
fields.sentence: I poked my finger on a thumb tack.

fields.definition: To postpone something is to make it happen later than planned.
fields.sentence: They postponed the meeting until Elena arrived.

fields.definition: When a liquid splashes, it bursts and hits something.
fields.sentence: Some green paint splashed upon the floor.

fields.definition: If people are stubborn, they don’t change their minds easily.
fields.sentence: Both of my parents are stubborn. They never give in to each other.

fields.definition: A suburb is a small part of a large city.
fields.sentence: I grew up in the suburbs only a few minutes outside of the city.

fields.definition: The tide is the level of the water in the sea.
fields.sentence: The tide continued to crawl upon the beach little by little.

fields.definition: A tragedy is a very sad event.
fields.sentence: It was a tragedy when his house was struck by lightning and burned.

fields.definition: A bomb is an object that explodes and destroys large areas.
fields.sentence: The bomb will destroy anything that is near.

fields.definition: A certificate is a document that says that something is true or happened.
fields.sentence: I was given a certificate after completing the computer course.

fields.definition: A circumstance is an event that makes a situation what it is.
fields.sentence: There were many circumstances behind their success like hard work.

fields.definition: A coffin is a box used to bury dead people.
fields.sentence: When a person passes away, they are usually buried inside of a coffin.

fields.definition: To cope with a difficult or stressful situation means to deal with it.
fields.sentence: He copes with work stress by exercising three or four times a week.

fields.definition: Criticism is the act of saying that you don’t like or approve of something.
fields.sentence: She had a lot of criticism about their new plan.

fields.definition: To devastate something means to completely destroy it.
fields.sentence: The entire wall was devastated.

fields.definition: To frown is to make an unhappy look with your face.
fields.sentence: Melissa frowned when she found out that the party had been cancelled.

fields.definition: To gaze at something means to look at it for a long time.
fields.sentence: We used a telescope to gaze at the stars for over an hour.

fields.definition: To glance at something means to look at it quickly.
fields.sentence: She glanced behind her to see if he was looking at her.

fields.definition: Grief is the feeling of deep sadness, usually when a person dies.
fields.sentence: The grief caused by losing her parents was very difficult for her.

fields.definition: A groom is a man who is going to be married.
fields.sentence: The groom looked happy as he walked with his new wife.

fields.definition: A license is an official document that gives one permission to do something.
fields.sentence: In the United States you need a driver’s license to drive legally.

fields.definition: A microscope is a device that makes small objects look bigger.
fields.sentence: Germs cannot be seen without a microscope.

fields.definition: When something is nuclear, it relates to the division or joining of atoms.
fields.sentence: Nuclear power plants provide inexpensive energy to cities.

fields.definition: To portray something means to describe it or show it in a picture.
fields.sentence: Her picture portrayed the house she grew up in when she was little.

fields.definition: To rotate something means to turn it around in a circle.
fields.sentence: An airplane’s propellers rotate quickly to help it fly.

fields.definition: A souvenir is something you buy to remind you of a place or event.
fields.sentence: I bought a Russian doll as a souvenir from my trip to Moscow.

fields.definition: A submarine is a boat that can go underwater for long periods of time.
fields.sentence: The submarine dove under the sea so the enemy couldn’t see it.

fields.definition: To trace something means to follow over it with the eyes or a finger.
fields.sentence: He traced over the graph with his finger.

fields.definition: An appliance is a piece of equipment used for jobs in the home.
fields.sentence: Many homes have appliances like ovens, toasters and refrigerators.

fields.definition: A basin is large bowl for washing things. A sink is sometimes called a basin.
fields.sentence: She filled the basin with water and washed her face.

fields.definition: A broom is a brush with a long handle used for cleaning floors.
fields.sentence: My father usually uses a broom to sweep away dust in the basement.

fields.definition: A caterpillar is a small insect that looks like a worm and eats plants.
fields.sentence: After eating a lot of leaves, caterpillars change into butterflies.

fields.definition: A cupboard is a piece of furniture that is used to store food or household items.
fields.sentence: We put all of our dishes and food in the cupboards.

fields.definition: If something or someone is delicate, they are easy to break or harm.
fields.sentence: You should hold the baby carefully because she’s very delicate.

fields.definition: To emerge from something means to come out of it.
fields.sentence: The hand suddenly emerged from the grave.

fields.definition: A handicap is a condition that limits someone’s mental or physical abilities.
fields.sentence: Joe has a slight handicap, so he uses a walker to get around.

fields.definition: A hook is a sharp curved piece of metal used for catching or holding things.
fields.sentence: The fish went after the sharp hook.

fields.definition: To hop means to jump a short distance.
fields.sentence: The kangaroo quickly hopped away from danger.

fields.definition: Laundry is clothes that have been or need to be washed.
fields.sentence: He folded the clean laundry and put the dirty laundry in a basket.

fields.definition: To pursue someone or something is to chase or follow them.
fields.sentence: The mother pursued her young child down the hill.

fields.definition: If someone is reluctant, they do not want to do something.
fields.sentence: She was reluctant to eat the meager breakfast.

fields.definition: Sleeves are the part of a shirt where your arms go.
fields.sentence: Ryan bought a new shirt with long sleeves to keep his arms warm.

fields.definition: The spine is the bone that runs up and down the middle of the back.
fields.sentence: Our spine helps us to stand up nice and straight.

fields.definition: A stain is a dirty mark that is difficult to clean.
fields.sentence: He had a red stain on the collar of his shirt.

fields.definition: A strip is a long, narrow piece of material or land.
fields.sentence: He had long strips of film that held images of his trip abroad.

fields.definition: To swear means to promise to do something.
fields.sentence: I will put my hand on the Bible and swear to do my best for the country.

fields.definition: To swing something means to move it back and forth or from side to side.
fields.sentence: He can swing a golf club very powerfully.

fields.definition: To utilize something means to use it for a specific purpose.
fields.sentence: They utilized a pair of scissors to cut the ribbon.
